sub_topic: Determining the length of a side in an isosceles triangle.
message_1: A triangle has two sides of equal length, and a third side that measures 7 cm. If the length of one of the equal sides is 5 cm, what is the length of the other equal side?
message_2: Since the triangle has two sides of equal length, and one of the equal sides is given as 5 cm, the other equal side will also be 5 cm in length.
